section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall fsItemCount_5

div.a: Carl Sandburg/Discovery Community School recognized as U.S. Department of Education Green Ribbon Schools on Earth Day

div.p: Kirkland, Wash. – The U.S. Department of Education announced today that Carl Sandburg Elementary and Discovery Community School are among the 2020 U.S. Department of Education Green Ribbon Schools award honorees.

div.a: State Board of Education recognizes 20 Lake Washington School District schools during #WASchoolsWeek

div.p: Redmond, Wash. – The State Board of Education (SBE), the Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI), and the Educational Opportunity Gap Oversight and Accountability Committee (EOGOAC) have identified 391 schools statewide to receive recognition. Schools in Washington stand out for closing gaps, showing growth, and demonstrating achievement according to new data released by the state.

div.a: Two LWSD students receive National Merit Corporate-Sponsored Scholarships

div.p: Redmond, Wash. – The National Merit Scholarship Corporation (NMSC) announced Wednesday that two Lake Washington School District seniors will receive National Merit Corporate-Sponsored Scholarships:

ul.li: Jenna Yuan, Eastlake H.S. - National Merit Boeing Scholarship
Jordan Rothkowitz, Redmond H.S. - National Merit Boeing Scholarship

div.a: Redmond High School student named semifinalist in US Presidential Scholars Program

div.p: Redmond High School senior Ananya Srivastava has been named one of 620 semifinalists in the 2020 U.S. Presidential Scholars Program.

div.a: Dr. Jon Holmen Named the Next LWSD Superintendent

div.p: Redmond, Wash. – The Lake Washington School District (LWSD) Board of Directors has selected Dr. Jon Holmen to be the next Lake Washington School District Superintendent. They announced their decision on Monday, March 23, 2020.

div.p: Each student will graduate prepared to lead a rewarding and responsible life as a contributing member of our community and greater society.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList student-centered-featured fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailMedium fsItemCount_4

div.p:
To prepare our students we believe that all students must have opportunities to learn a rich curriculum in inclusive classrooms.
Learn more about LWSD's Focus on Students

div.a: Carl Sandburg/Discovery Community School recognized as U.S. Department of Education Green Ribbon Schools on Earth Day

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-287 fsTag-3 fsTag-5 fsTag-6 fsTag-20

div.a: Comfort food – LWSD students participate in 7th Annual High School Culinary Competition

div.p: To continue growing as an organization, everyone must have access to learning opportunities that encourage ongoing growth and development.

p.a: Learn more about LWSD's Focus on Learning

div.p: These programs are designed to meet the learning styles and needs of students with superior intellectual, academic, and creative abilities.
Special education is not a “place:” rather, it is a set of services. The district’s goal is to partner with families regarding the individual needs of children.
Career and technical education (CTE) courses and programs help prepare students for a wide range of post-secondary high demand, skill, and wage opportunities.

p.a: Learn more about Career & Technical Education

div.p: Provides leadership for standards-based teaching and assessing to increase student access and engagement, close achievement and opportunity gaps, and support student learning and success.

Intervention services help students acquire English language proficiency, services for Native American students, and services designed to help mitigate the effects of poverty on student learning and success in school.
The EL program supports students in developing English language proficiency and academic success in all areas.
To be the best school district in the world, we are committed to high quality implementation of practices that produce positive change and sustainable transformation.

p.a: learn more about LWSD's Focus on Results

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList fsThumbnailSquare fsThumbnailMedium fsItemCount_2

div.title: “Whole Child, Whole School Sustainability” at Green Strides Tour

img.alt: “Whole Child, Whole School Sustainability” at Green Strides Tour

div.a: “Whole Child, Whole School Sustainability” at Green Strides Tour

div.p: Students and their families are integral to the success of sustainability initiatives in our district. They also played an important role during the Washington Green Strides Tour.

div.a: LINKS Lunch Buddy program gives kids additional support to succeed in school and life

div.p: Did you know when a mentor provides social-emotional support to a student, it can improve the child’s confidence and help them acquire skills needed for lifelong success? That’s what inspired 19 volunteers in the LINKS Lunch Buddy program at Rose Hill Elementary.
Lake Washington Schools Foundation

img.alt: A young female student reads with a female volunteer

div.p: Share your talents, gain experience and inspire a child
Ask questions or provide feedback

div.p: ©2020 Lake Washington School District

The Lake Washington School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, gender, marital status, creed, religion, honorably discharged veteran, military status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, the presence of any sensory, mental or physical disability, or the use of a trained guide dog or service animal by a person with a disability, in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups.
